result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron Michael Rud was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Judge Scott R. Needham March 31, 2017 - amend repeater enhancer in Count 1.

Court notes 11 days credit against ultimate sentence.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes: Maintain current AODA treatment and Mental Health treatment and follow through.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-Random and regular testing.
-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
-Follow any other recommendations of Agent.

$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF373.
$200.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF373.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be converted into a civil judgment.

Court authorizes Huber for work/seek work.
With good time.
If Defendant successfully completes 16 week AODA in the Jail, Court may bank remaining time and hold open for 1 year. After 1 year the STAYED portion would be eliminated.

Concurrent without prejudice to Consecutive if revoked.
Concurrent with:

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Erica Ellenwood DF ATTY: Alex Andrea DF: Aaron Michael Rud appeared from jail. Case called at 11:07. Includes 15CF373, 16CF78. Atty. Andrea updates the court on agreement.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to amended Ct 1 961.41(3g)(b) possession of a controlled substance repeater and amended Ct. 2 possession of paraphernalia repeater 939.62(1)(a) in16CF78, and G  to amended 16CF78 to misdemeanor bail jumping repeater the now single count in 16CF78. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. DE acknowledges priors. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of amended Ct 1 and amended Ct 2  in 15CF373 and guilty of amended Ct 1 in 16CF78. On motion of the State without objection Court dismisses Ct. 2 in 16CF78. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. 
Crt orders: Sentence W/H
On 15CF373 Ct. 1
2 years probation with conditions
  Court notes credit for 11 days against any ultimate sentence. 
- 15 days St. Croix County Jail
- Maintain current AODA treatment and mental health treatment and follow through. 
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times . This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- Random and regular testing. 
- Costs of $243.00
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $200.00
- Any other recommendation by the agent. 

Ct. 2
2 years probation with conditions
Probation is concurrent without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation.
- Costs of $243.00
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $200.00


On 16CF78 Ct.1
2 years probation with conditions
Probation is concurrent without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation.
- Costs of $243.00
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $200.00

Case recalled at 11:51. Same appearances. Atty. Andrea contacted Chippewa County, there is an open file 15CF461. Chippewa has agreed to reading in their cases and dismissing it. ADA Ellenwood is comfortable with moving forward and will confirm the receipt of the complaint later today. Court reads in and dismisses Chippewa County 15CF461.

INCLUDES 16CF78 and 15CF373

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Report every Saturday before 5:00pm  to St Croix County Jail for UA testing, in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex and provide a valid/verified UA sample.  If UA tests positive or if a valid/verified sample is not provided, defendant shall submit to additional evidentiary testing to determine the use of substances forbidden by this bond agreement at the jail or Hudson Hospital.  Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each test. This would be waived if he is testing with his Treatment Program (and notify Clerk of Court in writing).

Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA: Francis D. Collins   DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton   DF:  Aaron Michael Rud appeared from jail.  Case called at 10:31 a.m. Peter Rud appears by phone, defendant's father. Court reviews file. Jail performed a test last evening and came back clean. Court directs Peter Rud explaining the co-signature bond. Peter Rud is not willing to co-sign bond. Atty Caton states mother is willing to co-sign a bond. Father is not willing to post the cash bond either. Atty Caton makes statement. Pastor at church in Menomonie would be willing for defendant to stay there. Court at this time is denying motion to modify bond. Court would like to speak to the pastor in person if that is where the defendant will be staying.
Bail/bond hearing at 08-21-2015 10:30 am

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton   DF:  Aaron Michael Rud appeared from jail. Case called at 4:27 p.m. Atty Caton filed a Motion to Modify Bond. No stipulation reached with the state. Gives argument. Proposing a signature bond with regular and random testing by the Dunn Co. Sheriff's Office. ADA McKinley objects. Rebuttal by Atty Caton. ADA McKinley would like to hear from parents for a possible co-signature bond. Court would like to hear from parent or whomever would co-sign the bond and 3 times a week testing and testing before being released. Court will not modify at this time. Court will order defendant to be tested tonight.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 10:30 am.
